t: For*p Zion's sake will I not hold my peace, and for Jerusalem's sake I will not rest, until the righteousness thereof go forth as brightness, and the salvation thereof as a lamp that burneth.
And*p the Gentiles shall see thy righteousness, and all kings thy glory: and thou shalt be called by a new name, which the mouth of the Lord*s shall name.
Thou*p shalt also be a crown of glory in the hand of the Lord,*s and a royal diadem in the hand of thy God.

Thou*p shalt no more be termed Forsaken; neither shall thy land any more be termed Desolate: but thou shalt be called Hephziâ€“bah, and thy land Beulah: for the Lord*s delighteth in thee, and thy land shall be married.
For*p as a young man marrieth a virgin, so shall thy sons marry thee: and as the bridegroom rejoiceth over the bride, so shall thy God rejoice over thee.
I*p have set watchmen upon thy walls, O Jerusalem, which shall never hold their peace day nor night: ye that make mention of the Lord,*s keep not silence,
And*p give him no rest, till he establish, and till he make Jerusalem a praise in the earth.

The*p Lord*s hath sworn by his right hand, and by the arm of his strength, Surely I will no more give thy corn to be meat for thine enemies; and the sons of the stranger shall not drink thy wine, for the which thou hast laboured:
But*p they that have gathered it shall eat it, and praise the Lord;*s and they that have brought it together shall drink it in the courts of my holiness.
Go*p through, go through the gates; prepare ye the way of the people; cast up, cast up the highway; gather out the stones; lift up a standard for the people.
Behold,*p the Lord*s hath proclaimed unto the end of the world, Say ye to the daughter of Zion, Behold, thy salvation cometh; behold, his reward is with him, and his work before him.
And*p they shall call them, The holy people, The redeemed of the Lord:*s and thou shalt be called, Sought out, A city not forsaken.
